App description:
vSpatial brings your workspace to the Quest

Surround yourself with unlimited monitors and jump into focus mode. Access your favorite browser, professional working/ design tools, and music streaming apps in VR. vSpatial supports all Windows 10 apps and is already integrated into professional businesses today.

PRODUCTIVITY (On virtual steroids)
Multi-task by surrounding yourself with a ring of multiple apps and windows to see everything youre working on at once
Resize and isolate apps
Safe and secure remote desktop
Bluetooth mouse and keyboard support
Take a break with basketball

COLLABORATION (With your team)
Seamlessly bring your team into your workspace with Collaboration Pro
Work together by sharing multiple app screens
Let your contacts join your space with avatars to share and draw on whatever screens/ apps you want
Crystal clear spatial audio to distinguish teammates
Purchase section: FreeAdd to WishlistShareOffers In-App PurchasesComfortableSupports QuestSupports Oculus TouchInternet connection required

vSpatial Privacy Policy
vSpatial Privacy Policy

Updated: 08.12.2020

Introduction

At vSpatial (we, our, or us), we believe you should know what data we collect from you and how we use it. That is the purpose of this Privacy Policy. It explains what data we collect about you and why, what we do with the data, and how we handle that data. We also explain what choices you have with respect to the data.

You should read this policy in full, but there are a few key things that we hope you understand and take away from it:

When you use our website, even if you are just browsing, or use vSpatial, we receive some personal information about you like the type of device you are using and your IP address.
You may sign up for a user account to use our Services (defined below) and provide additional information to us like your name, email address, company, and role within your company. We use this information to provide Services to you, to administer our systems, and enable additional features of the Services.
We do not market to or target persons in the European Union or EFTA States. The United States of America does not provide the same rights as those specified in the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
You can contact us at contact@vspatial.com if you have questions about this Policy, or how we collect or process your Personal Data.
Applicability of this Privacy Policy and Consent

This Privacy Policy applies to vSpatial applications (Software), the services we provide, our website, (together the website, Software, and services that support either is referred to as the Services), data we collect (explained below), and your interactions with us (e.g., customer service inquiries, email or other communication exchanges, etc.).

This Privacy Policy does not apply to third party services, including services offered by other companies that may be displayed to you during the use of our Services. Data collected and processed by third parties is subject to their own privacy policies. We encourage you to learn about the privacy practices of those third parties.

A separate agreement governs delivery, access, and use of the Services (the Terms of Service).

You should read this Privacy Policy to make sure you understand what data we collect and how we collect and use your data. If you do not agree with our policies, please do not access, or use our website, or utilize our Services. By accessing or using our website, or utilizing our Services, you agree to this Privacy Policy.

This Privacy Policy may change from time to time and we post any updated privacy policies on our website. Please note that your continued use of this website or Services after any change means that you agree with, and consent to be bound by, the new policy.

Data We Collect and Receive

In Short: We collect personal information that you provide to us such as name, address, passwords (hashed) and security data.

When you interact with our website, marketing, and use our applications, we collect data that alone, or in combination with other data, could be used to identify you (Personal Data). Some of the data we collect is stored in a manner that cannot be linked back to you (Non-Personal Data). We do not know your password, nor can it be retrieved.

Information You Disclose to Us

Our Services allow you to sign up for an account. When you do, we may ask for Personal Data, including the following:

Name and Contact Data: your name, email address(es), contact information, your company, and role within the company. We will also ask you to create a display name.
Credentials: passwords, password hints, and similar security information used for authentication and account access. We never store passwords in clear text form; therefore, we do not know your password, nor can it be retrieved.

All information that you provide to us must be true, complete, and accurate. You must notify us of any changes to such personal information.

Data that you provide to us may be collected through our partners and service providers, such as our web hosting services.

Information Automatically Collected
In Short: We automatically collect certain information such as your IP address and device characteristics when you connect to our Services.

Certain data about the devices you use to connect to our Services, and your use of our Services are automatically logged in our system, including:

Location information. This is the IP address, geographic area, state, city where you use your computing devices and mobile devices when interacting with our website or using our Services.
Log data. As with most websites and technology services delivered over the internet, our servers automatically collect data when you access or use our website or Services and record it in log files. This log data may include your IP address, browser type and settings, date and time of use, language data, and cookie data.
Services User data. This is information about our Services, how you use them, and how others using them interact with you. We also assign unique identifiers to meetings and track these identifiers. We also track performance and error data, the Services version you use, a unique application number assigned to your installation, which applications you use while using our Services, and so forth. As noted below in How We Use your Data, the Services User data is intended to provide useful experiences and features to the User.
Website data. This is information about our website and how you use it. We may also obtain data from our third-party partners and services providers to analyze how you use our website. For example, we will know how many users access a specific page on our website and which links they clicked on. We use this aggregated information to better understand and optimize our website.
Platform and device information. This is data from your computing or mobile device, such as the type of hardware and software you are using (for example, your CPU, graphic device(s), operating system, and so forth), and may include unique device identifiers for your devices. It also includes the platform (such as whether you are on Steam or Oculus Rift), version numbers, and other related data.
Cookies

In Short: We use cookies and similar technologies.

vSpatial uses cookies and similar technologies in our websites that help us collect usage information. Our website may also include cookies and similar tracking devices of third parties, which may collect information about you across other websites and online services.

Third Party Data

In Short: We receive information about you from our marketing partners, affiliates, and subsidiaries.

vSpatial may receive data about website visitors, marketing campaigns, and other matters related to our business from affiliates and subsidiaries, our partners, or others that we use to make our own information and Services better or more useful. This data may be combined with other information we collect and might include aggregate level data, such as which IP addresses correspond to zip codes or countries. Or it might be more specific, such as how well an online marketing or email campaign performed.

Additional Information Provided to vSpatial

In Short: We receive information about you from other interactions with vSpatial.

We receive other information when submitted to our website or if you participate in a focus group, contest, activity, or event, apply for a job, request support, interact with our social media accounts or otherwise communicate with vSpatial.

Information Collected from Children

In Short: We do not knowingly collect information from children.

vSpatial does not knowingly collect personal information from users under the age of 18. Our website and Services are directed to persons who are at least 18 years old. If we determine that we have collected personal information from people under the age of 18, we will take reasonable measures to remove that information from our systems. We encourage parents and legal guardians to monitor their childrens Internet usage to help enforce this Policy by instructing their children never to provide personal information through our website without their permission.

No Rights Under the GDPR

In Short: If you live in the European Union or EFTA States you understand and agree that your data will be transferred to, stored in, and accessed in the United States, which does not have the same rights as specified in the GDPR.

We do not market to or target persons in the European Union or EFTA States. If you are located in a geographic region outside the United States of America and choose to use our Services, you understand that your data will be transferred to, accessed in, and stored in, the United States of America and you give your explicit consent to vSpatial to transfer your data to the United States of America.

How We Use Your Data

In Short: We process your information for purposes based on legitimate business interests, in fulfillment of our Terms of Service with you, compliance with our legal obligations, customized user features and experiences, and services improvements.

We use, process, and store your data as necessary to provide services to you, in operating our website, and offering our Services, including:

To provide our Services to you.
To help us administer our Services, authenticate users for security purposes, provide personalized user features and access, conduct research, develop new features, and improve the features, algorithms, and usability of our Services. Services User data as described above is only used to enhance the user experience and provide features specific to the user. We do not share User Services Data.
To calculate aggregate statistics on the number of unique individuals and/or devices using our Services.
To send periodic emails. We may send you service, technical, and administrative emails. We may also contact you to inform you about changes in our Services, inform you of security and fraud events, and send you other Services-related information.
To improve our products and offerings. Using analytical platforms, we will map broader analytical trends and patterns, making sure our products align with what our customers need and improve marketing materials. Data used in this way is anonymized, it is not trackable back to the user.
To enhance product advertising campaigns of vSpatial.
To investigate and help prevent security issues, fraud, and abuse.
As required by applicable law, legal process, or regulation.
How We Share and Disclose Your Data

In Short: We will only share your information with your consent, to comply with laws, to protect your rights, or to fulfill business obligations.

We only disclose Personal Data to third parties when:

We use service providers who assist us in meeting business operation needs, including hosting and administering our website, and delivering and improving our products. We also use service providers for specific services and functions, including email communication, customer support services, and analytics.
We have your explicit consent to share your Personal Data (if required).
Using our Services to interact with others necessitates that certain information be disclosed to those you interact with, including your display name.
We believe it is necessary to investigate potential violations of our Terms of Service, or where we believe it is necessary to investigate, prevent, or take action regarding illegal activities, suspected fraud, or potential threats against persons, property, or the systems on which we operate our Services.
We determine that the access, preservation, or disclosure of your Personal Data is required by law, or to protect the rights, property, or personal safety of vSpatial or users of our Services, or to respond to lawful requests by public authorities, including national security or law enforcement requests.
We need to do so in connection with a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy, reorganization, sale of some or all of our assets or stock, public offering of securities, or steps in consideration of such activities (e.g., due diligence). In these cases, some or all of your Personal Data may be shared with or transferred to another entity, subject to this Privacy Policy.

vSpatial does not share your Personal Data with third parties for the purpose of enabling them to deliver their advertisements to you. vSpatial does not sell, trade, or rent your Personal Data.

Data Storage, Transfer, Retention, and Deletion

In Short: We process your data in the United States, keep your data only as long as necessary, and safeguard your data using industry standard practices.

Data Storage and Transfers

Data submitted to vSpatial will be transferred to, processed, and stored in the United States of America. When you use the Services on your computing device, user content you save will be stored locally on that device and synced with our servers. If you post or transfer any information to or through our Services, you are agreeing to such information, including Personal Data and user content, being hosted, and accessed in the United States.

Duration of Storage

You can remove your Personal Data from vSpatial at any time by contacting us at contact@vspatial.com. However, we may keep some of your Personal Data for as long as reasonably necessary, including fraud detection and prevention and to comply with our legal obligations including tax, legal reporting, and auditing obligations.

Safeguards

When you give us personal information, we take steps to make sure that it is treated securely.

Non-sensitive details (your name, email address, etc.) are sent encrypted normally over the Internet, and this can never be guaranteed to be 100% secure. As a result, while we strive to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee the security of any information you transmit to us, and you do so at your own risk. Once we receive your information, we make our best effort to ensure its security on our systems.

We use industry standard encryption to protect your data in transit. This is commonly referred to as transport layer security (TLS) or secure socket layer (SSL) technology.

Once we receive your data, we protect it on our servers using a combination of physical, technical, and logical security safeguards. The security of data stored on your computing devices is solely within your control and we recommend you take the appropriate steps to secure your computing devices that you use in connection with our website and Services.

Contacting Us

If you have any questions regarding this privacy policy, to request removal of your data, or to request removal of data collected from a minor under the age of 18, please contact us at contact@vspatial.com.

Gilliosa10 days ago
Wow, this is great!

I have tried many other remote desktop type applications on the Quest and I have always thought it was limiting to only show the desktop monitor in VR. I was hoping an app would come along that would allow for interaction with the individual windows, and here it is! Not just that, but this is the most responsive and reliable remote desktop software I have used to date!

There are a few enhancements I hope to see in future releases:

1. Hand tracking. Rather than using the controller all the time, it would be nice to be able to use hands in VR. There would be a loss in functionality tied to controller buttons but it is far more intuitive to use hands when interacting with computer programs than it is the Oculus controllers.

2. Additional carousels. Currently there is a predefined work carousel. It would be nice to see the ability to add additional work carousels.

3. Multiple full screen windows. It would be nice to have two full screen windows opened at the same time. The ability to make a window full screen and reduce the clutter of the other windows is invaluable. But there are many times when you need to compare two screens side by side without other distractions.

4. Right-click mouse function. Unless I'm missing something I am not able to figure out how to simulate a right-click on a mouse.

5. Not something I expect these spatial to provide but I really hope someone develops a VR physical keyboard. Like the Oculus controllers which can be viewable within the VR, it would be nice to have a physical keyboard which you can see within VR but type on physically like any other keyboard. Let's face it, computers are not quite ready to go without a mouse and keyboard.

Helpful | 16

pantherhead11 days ago
I expect it in the future

When it comes to virtual desktop features, Virtual Desktop is more comfortable with less latency.
The ability to resize the view for each application is great.
Switching windows is also very comfortable.
I haven't tried the collaboration, so I don't know.
I expect it in the future.

R_Steelman615 days ago
Get work done in VR!

This is a great app for bringing your PC screen and apps into VR. Takes all your apps and converts them to discrete windows. Remember this is from a device with one physical screen and in VR i typically have 8. Helps organize your work efforts and surrounds you with your apps/windows so you can quickly get to what you need. Go into focus mode to concentrate on that one app or document and remove all the other distractions. I work in VR several hours a week using vSpatial and love it.
To have meetings with those on PC, they will need the free workstation app from www.vspatial.com to join you. Once they have it they can join you from the desktop while you are in VR.
The negative reviews i am seeing seem really petty. It doesn't support Linux or Mac so 2 stars? I have latency so 1 star? Look do some research. You need Windows, you need a good connection, you need a decent PC or laptop. I've worked several hours a week for months in vSpatial (as have others, check the Discord) and can testify IT WORKS! Its a different way of working and you have to dedicate yourself to adapting your workflow but once you do, you WILL be more efficient.
Check out my overview at VR 4 Work on YouTube https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOPivLudusITkFvxUMzu3SA

kyle.mammen10 days ago
Great for productivity!

When compared to using a traditional monitor this app gives me a critical tool to focus on what Im working and to ignore the distractions of other programs and the environment. When stuck in an open office and I need to get something done, this helps me stay on task, while communicating to those around me that Im working on something important.

The ability to organize my windows into the carrousel and to go into focus mode on the most important window are the killer features for me. The collaborative elements are also impressive and show a ton of potential as more people adopt the app.

mbustin6 hours ago
Very Nice Program

Ive used Virtual Desktop (nice), Immersed (nice), Spatial (ok) and vSpatial. I have to say that Im most excited about vSpatial and its potential. Interface is very good and handles multiple screens better than other apps. Using a BT keyboard with touchscreen linked to a laptop works well, now all I need to do is become a better touch typist. Not completely ready for ideal work until the resolution on the headsets improves and the Quest screen door effect is improved on - but thats not vSpatials fault. Also until companys VPNs allow these clients, I cant yet do everything I would like. Hopefully, someday.

Developer Response5 days ago

Hey slipperedlobster, We have a major update to our remote desktop manager coming soon that'll help us with with streaming your PC over the internet (instead of just your local network) as well as improve fps & latency. This also is the right step forward for us to increase the devices we can remote to (MAC, Linux, etc). Mac should be coming later this year and then we'll focus on Linux soon after that. Hope that helps!

ugavelab2 days ago
Definitely worth trying out

The foveated rendering settings are all wrong, and the built-in web browser is very slow and hard to use (why no click to drag?). The basketball throwing is quite unreliable (so many good games to use as examples of how to do this right). Latency is among the worst of these types of applications. But, despite its flaws, I love the general ideas being presented, which contrast really nicely against some of the other systems that are purely remote-desktop oriented. Immersed has shown that usable latency is quite possible, so this application should be able to get better.

powshopow4 days ago
Not really for working

I can see the potential for collaboration, but the remote desktop function is not a very efficient way to work. The graphics are not sharp enough to read, the carousel is not ergonomic and not a lot of options to make it ergonomic. Using the physical keyboard and mouse is impossible when you're accessing the apps by itself instead of through desktop. It was frustrating to move the keypad around as well, grabbing it would sometimes overshoot and you'd end up vacuuming one of the workspace windows. Good thing it's free.

Developer Response5 days ago

Hey AbyssDJ, Glad you're liking it thus far, we have a major update to our remote desktop connection coming soon that should improve the fps and latency. You might try increasing the app ring size by holding and grabbing the arrows to the left of your center view to adjust the screen sizes. You can also hit the AAA button on the bottom of each screen to adjust the resolution. Hope that helps!
